result.execSummary:
The defendant Colton R. Melander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Colton R. Melander is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Colton R. Melander was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Term of probation to begin forthwith 01/07/2016.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.
Review hearing 7/14/17 @ 9am; P&P to provide written report by 7/11/17.  DOC shall promptly notify the Court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the Deft.

timeConds.notes:
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION court imposes 120 days KCJ.  No huber allowed.
**AS OF 07/20/17 - Deft had yet to begin his probation term; therefore, the 120 days conditional jail ordered on 07/14/17 is to be removed.

JOC shall be amended to reflect the probation commenced on the day of sentencing on 1/7/2016.

120 days conditional jail time.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Case brought to court on a scheduled review from time of sentencing.  Letter received from agent.  Defense counsel reports the deft is presently on a PO hold.  Court imposes 120 days KCJ as condition of probation for violations.  No huber.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Wm. Michel.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years consecutive to Eau Claire Co cases 14CF1057/15CF13/15CF25/15CF148.  DNA ordered if not previously complied with; surcharge ordered.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  RH set for 7/14/17 @ 9am.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Atty Michel appeared on behalf of the defense.  Deft not transported from the KCJ.  Sentencing hrg adjourned to 1/7/16 @ 3pm.  State is recommending consecutive probation in this case and the deft has not been sentenced yet in the previous case.
revocation summary from Eau Claire Co cases

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Michel.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 12/3/15 @ 11am.

file was received in Branch 3 on 10/5/15; SCO was done as soon as the file was received
to Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Colton R. Melander appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 3.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:40 pm.  Jury selection scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
